    • NewOrdersController

      public NewOrdersController()

  • Method Details

    • setCashierID

      public void setCashierID(int cashierID)
      Sets the current cashier ID for order tracking and database operations. This ID is used when inserting orders into the database to track which cashier processed the order.
      Parameters:
      cashierID - The unique identifier of the current cashier

    • getCashierID

      public int getCashierID()
      Retrieves the current cashier ID that is being used for order tracking.
      Returns:
      The unique identifier of the current cashier

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the NewOrdersController by setting up the UI components and loading menu items from the database. This method is called automatically by JavaFX after the FXML file is loaded.

    • initializeDatabase

      private void initializeDatabase()
      Establishes a connection to the database using the App class's connection method. This method sets up the database connection that will be used throughout the controller.

    • loadMenuItems

      private void loadMenuItems()
      Loads all active menu items from the database and dynamically creates buttons for each item. Items are categorized by type (meal, side, entree, other) and placed in appropriate panes.

    • createMenuButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button createMenuButton(String itemName, double price, char mealType)
      Creates a button for a menu item with appropriate styling and event handlers. The button displays the item name and price, and handles both left-click and right-click actions.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the menu item
      price - The price of the menu item
      mealType - The type of meal item ('M', 'S', 'E', or 'D')
      Returns:
      A configured Button object for the menu item

    • addItemToOrder

      private void addItemToOrder(String itemName, double price, char mealType, boolean half)
      Adds an item to the current order with proper meal validation and portion handling. This method handles the complex logic for meal requirements and multiple portions.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item to add
      price - The price of the item
      mealType - The type of item ('M' for meal, 'S' for side, 'E' for entree, 'D' for drink)
      half - Whether this is a half portion

    • handleMultipleSidesOrEntrees

      private void handleMultipleSidesOrEntrees(String itemName, double price, char mealType, boolean half)
      Handles adding multiple sides or entrees to a meal with proper portion distribution. This method manages the complex logic of meal portioning and ensures proper limits are enforced.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the side or entree to add
      price - The price of the item
      mealType - The type of item ('S' for side, 'E' for entree)
      half - Whether this is a half portion

    • resetSidesAndEntrees

      private void resetSidesAndEntrees()
      Resets all half portions of sides and entrees back to full portions. This is called when a new meal is added to ensure proper portioning.

    • getCurrentMeal

      private String getCurrentMeal(javafx.collections.ObservableList<NewOrdersController.OrderItem> items)
      Finds the current meal in the order list.
      Parameters:
      items - The list of order items to search through
      Returns:
      The name of the current meal, or null if no meal is found

    • canAddNewMeal

      private boolean canAddNewMeal()
      Determines if a new meal can be added to the order based on current meal requirements. Validates that the current meal has the required sides and entrees before allowing a new meal.
      Returns:
      true if a new meal can be added, false otherwise

    • getLimitForMealType

      private int getLimitForMealType(String mealName, char itemType)
      Gets the base limit for sides or entrees based on the meal type.
      Parameters:
      mealName - The name of the meal (Bowl, Plate, Bigger Plate)
      itemType - The type of item ('S' for side, 'E' for entree)
      Returns:
      The base limit for the item type

    • getMaxLimitForMealType

      private int getMaxLimitForMealType(String mealName, char itemType)
      Gets the maximum limit for sides or entrees based on the meal type.
      Parameters:
      mealName - The name of the meal (Bowl, Plate, Bigger Plate)
      itemType - The type of item ('S' for side, 'E' for entree)
      Returns:
      The maximum limit for the item type

    • distributePortionsEvenly

      private void distributePortionsEvenly(char mealType, int totalItems)
      Distributes portions evenly among existing items of the same type when adding new items. This ensures that the total quantity remains consistent when adding multiple sides or entrees.
      Parameters:
      mealType - The type of meal item ('S' for side, 'E' for entree)
      totalItems - The total number of items of this type

    • convertOneToHalf

      private void convertOneToHalf(char mealType)
      Converts one full portion item to a half portion to make room for additional items. This is used when the maximum limit is reached but more items need to be added.
      Parameters:
      mealType - The type of meal item ('S' for side, 'E' for entree)

    • convertAllToHalf

      private void convertAllToHalf(char mealType)
      Converts all full portion items of a specific type to half portions. This method is used for special cases where all items need to be converted.
      Parameters:
      mealType - The type of meal item ('S' for side, 'E' for entree)

    • convertExistingToHalf

      private void convertExistingToHalf(char mealType)
      Converts the first existing full portion item to a half portion. This is a helper method for portion management.
      Parameters:
      mealType - The type of meal item ('S' for side, 'E' for entree)

    • convertRemainingHalfToFull

      private void convertRemainingHalfToFull(NewOrdersController.OrderItem removedItem)
      Converts a remaining half portion item back to full portion when another half portion is removed. This maintains proper portion consistency in the order.
      Parameters:
      removedItem - The item that was removed from the order

    • updateTotalLabel

      private void updateTotalLabel()
      Updates the total label to display the current order total. This method is called whenever items are added or removed from the order.

    • validateOrderItems

      private boolean validateOrderItems(javafx.collections.ObservableList<NewOrdersController.OrderItem> items)
      Validates that all menu items in the order exist in the database. This method ensures that all items in the order are valid menu items before processing.
      Parameters:
      items - List of order items to validate
      Returns:
      true if all items are valid, false otherwise

    • checkInventoryAvailability

      private boolean checkInventoryAvailability(javafx.collections.ObservableList<NewOrdersController.OrderItem> items)
      Checks if all required ingredients are available in inventory for the order. This method calculates the total ingredients needed and verifies stock levels.
      Parameters:
      items - List of order items to check
      Returns:
      true if all ingredients are available, false otherwise

    • calculateRequiredIngredients

      private Map<Integer,Double> calculateRequiredIngredients(javafx.collections.ObservableList<NewOrdersController.OrderItem> items)
      Calculates the total required ingredients for all items in the order. This method queries the database to determine ingredient requirements and quantities.
      Parameters:
      items - List of order items
      Returns:
      Map of inventory ID to required quantity

    • updateInventoryAfterOrder

      private boolean updateInventoryAfterOrder(javafx.collections.ObservableList<NewOrdersController.OrderItem> items)
      Updates inventory by subtracting the required ingredients after successful order completion. This method reduces stock levels based on the ingredients used in the order.
      Parameters:
      items - List of order items
      Returns:
      true if successful, false otherwise

    • insertOrder

      private boolean insertOrder(javafx.collections.ObservableList<NewOrdersController.OrderItem> items, String paymentType, double totalPrice)
      Inserts a completed order into the database with all its components. This method handles the complex database operations required to save an order with line items and meal components.
      Parameters:
      items - List of order items
      paymentType - Payment method used (Cash, Card, Mobile)
      totalPrice - Total price of the order
      Returns:
      true if successful, false otherwise

    • processOrderItems

      private void processOrderItems(int orderID, javafx.collections.ObservableList<NewOrdersController.OrderItem> items) throws SQLException
      Processes all order items, grouping meals with their components. Creates line items for each meal type and links components as meal items.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The ID of the order being processed
      items - The list of order items to process
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there's an error processing the order items

    • createMealLineItem

      private int createMealLineItem(int orderID, NewOrdersController.OrderItem mealItem) throws SQLException
      Creates a line item for a meal and returns the line item ID. This method inserts a record into the lineItems table for meal items.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The ID of the order this line item belongs to
      mealItem - The meal item to create a line item for
      Returns:
      The ID of the created line item
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there's an error creating the line item

    • createMealComponent

      private void createMealComponent(int lineItemID, NewOrdersController.OrderItem component) throws SQLException
      Creates a meal component (side or entree) linked to a meal line item. This method inserts records into the mealItems table for sides and entrees.
      Parameters:
      lineItemID - The ID of the line item this component belongs to
      component - The meal component (side or entree) to create
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there's an error creating the meal component

    • createIndividualLineItem

      private void createIndividualLineItem(int orderID, NewOrdersController.OrderItem item) throws SQLException
      Creates a line item for individual items (drinks, etc.). This method handles items that are not part of a meal structure.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The ID of the order this line item belongs to
      item - The individual item to create a line item for
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there's an error creating the line item

    • handleBackToCashier

      private void handleBackToCashier(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles navigation back to the cashier view when the back button is clicked. This method switches the scene to the POS.fxml file.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event from the button click

    • handleRemoveSelectedItem

      private void handleRemoveSelectedItem()
      Handles removing a selected item from the order list. If no item is selected, it removes the last item in the list. This method also handles portion conversion when removing half portions.

    • handlePaymentSelection

      private void handlePaymentSelection()
      Handles payment method selection from the dropdown menu. This method is called when the user selects a payment type (Cash, Card, Mobile).

    • handleCompleteOrder

      private void handleCompleteOrder()
      Handles completing the current order by validating all requirements and processing the order. This method performs comprehensive validation including meal requirements, payment selection, inventory availability, and database insertion.
